If your group is active and out and about most of the time, this shouldn't be much of a problem. However, we ate in and tried to cook a Christmas dinner there which was a bit of a challenge. We were warm and comfortable and the beds are great. It's just that this place is a better match for a larger group that eat breakfast and lunch in and goes out for dinner. Loved the old hardwood floors.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Hannah's place is exactly as it is described and exactly what the photos show. Hannah's communication was amazing and almost always responded in less than an hour. For the most part it was a great stay. However, there were 2 big things (big for me, might not bother others) that made me rate it 3 stars. Privacy is important to me and my family. We traveled with young children and all the curtains in the living room and kitchen are see through and there was no window covering over the window above the kitchen sink. Especially at night with lights on. Anyone could easily see straight into the house. The other thing that really bothered us was that we couldn't turn off the porch light. This made bugs a huge problem as the porch light and the living room light was right next to the front door. therefore Everytime we opened the front door mosquitos and other bugs came into the house.

Upon contacting the host early in the morning, Hannah was there within 2 hours or so with extra towels since other guest must have â€œ borrowedâ€ them, and with 2 exhaust fans for the upstairs windows as well as a circulating fan to help the air condition cool off the upstairs which made it comfortable to sleep upstairs. She was very friendly and set up the fans and left blow up beds if we still had an issue. She was in and out within 10 minutes or less as not to encroach upon our visit. The beds were extra comfortable and we all slept well. We were feeling just like home, then it was time to leave. We would stay there again if in Youngstown.

Very cozy place, large kitchen, dining room, bedrooms, master bathroom, plenty of closet space. Extremely clean. Plenty of extra linens, comfortable beds. The digital keypad made easy entry for both of us families arriving at slightly different times. Easy access to major highways. Owners were very reachable and friendly for checkin and a simple question we had. Neighborhood felt safe.
Location is a bit noisier than a neighborhood, as it is on a 4 lane 35mph road. Wifi is DSL and isn't extremely fast, but was adequate for normal surfing, not sure if remotely working would be smooth or streaming multiple HD video streams, but that's not why we were there. It's probably all that is available in the area.
Overall, this is a great place to stay in Youngstown and we would stay there again.

name: Sarah
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
July 2018
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Theresa easily accommodated our last-minute booking (we were in town for a family emergency) and was very patient as we communicated with her about potentially adding other family members to our reservation. We weren't able to meet her during our stay, but she checked in on us and we were able to check-in easily.
The space is immaculate and wide-open. It was well situated for our needs, and we loved that we were so close to Mill Creek Park. All of the basics were covered!
Our only negative feedback is that we did not find the beds or pillows to be comfortable. I know this is frequently a matter of preference, but looking back at the listing photos I can actually see some sagging that I didn't notice before I booked. To be fair, we did not make the time to contact Theresa during our stay, so it is possible that they may have tried to correct the problem if we had--we simply didn't have the time or emotional bandwidth to handle that among our family obligations.
Otherwise, we wholeheartedly endorse staying at Theresa's place! Thanks again.

review_text: We were in town for my niece's graduation and this was very convenient to Youngstown State campus, roughly 15 minutes. It's on a quiet tree-lined street with cute older houses. It was a little hard to find when we arrived after dark, so thank goodness for GPS. The house has been updated somewhat, particularly the kitchen. It has plenty of amenities if you want to cook. There's plenty of space in the living area, a good place to hang out with a few family members. There was a kid's play room with some toys, which was nice. The bedrooms were a good size and the bed was comfortable. It's memory foam, which isn't for everyone, but it slept nice. The main bathroom was spruced up and worked well. Of course the shower head is a little low, but it is an old house. It was a little warm while there, so having a newer AC system was a plus. Overall a good visit and a cute little house to stay in versus a cramped hotel room farther away. Nicole is a great host, very communicative.

review_text: We were in Youngstown to visit family after a death in the family so being close to family with a place to hang out in between was key. The house was really roomy and as someone who lives in an old house, I can say the bedrooms were unusually large and easily fit the king beds with room to spare. Certainly not necessary for us, but nice in comparison to our small bedrooms back home. If you're a runner, it's about 2 miles from Mill Creek Park, so run from here, or easily drive to the park to start your run. Mill Creek is one of our favorite places to run, and we've run in a lot of places! We did do all our cooking, and were cooking some for family. Plenty of room to cook and a full size slow cooker was great. Because we cooked so much, we did need some cooking tools not there, but for most people doing basic cooking, you are fine. Really a great short term living experience during a difficult time. Loved this older house in a residential neighborhood.

review_text: Erin's place was much nicer than expected! It is a very large space, with 15-foot high ceilings, flooded with wonderful natural light (from west-facing and north-facing windows); with gorgeous warm-tone old wooden floors; comfortable furniture (nicer than what the photos show); a kitchenette with an induction cook-top, microwave, and coffee maker; a fireplace and modern heating; a shower with a pebble floor; nice towels and linens and very comfortable bed. The space was perfect for yoga, dancing, photography, relaxing. It is in an old school building that is being renovated/re-done; on a road with some traffic noise; in a neighborhood that is old-industrial, just off the highway -- none of which bothered us at all. We found it to be peaceful, relaxing, eclectic. And super clean. Kudos to Erin for transforming an historic old school building into an attractive, unique place to stay.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Based on the listing pictures and description I thought this was a fully renovated old school with a bunch of nice apartments in it, but it's really more like a demolition zone with a few finished rooms. The kitchen was a bit rundown and the furniture isn't new and modern like it is in the pics - all the couches and chairs looked like old garage sale buys. The high ceilings were awesome, but the floors are thin so it was hard to sleep through all the noises from the person above me (but it's also not the host's fault that they watching movies UNTIL 4:30 AM with the volume up - I also love Rush Hour 2, just not at 2AM). There's also a lot of traffic noise from the street and the highway, so all in all it was not a great night's sleep, but the studio itself was spacious & warm, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was nice and looked like it was recently redone. It would have been fine for the night, it was a cool space - just a bit more shabby-chic than I was expecting!

review_text: I was looking for an inexpensive stay near a factory I was visiting for a business trip. I needed something close by the factory that had reliable internet and a kitchen and wanted to avoid a hotel so I could buy groceries and make my meals. Erin's place was exactly that. It was very inexpensive compared to a hotel. The bonus for me was that it was a beautiful light-filled space that was inspiring and had character. Working on the road can suck the life out of you -- especially in a cookie-cutter hotel. Erin's loft was unique and beautiful and the inside was large and had amazing wooden floors and a personality to it. I enjoy shooting photography as one of my favorite hobbies and the interior and surrounding area nearby were so interesting to photograph. Full transparency...this area is not bustling with nightlife or a pristine, new development. It has a little bit of grit to it but in a way that I appreciated. Erin was friendly and I had a smooth stay. Highly recommend!

This was a fantastic stay! The converted school building is a lovely building, and the apartment is beyond beautiful. With plenty of comfy places to lounge and sleep, the beautiful hardwood floors and sweepingly high ceilings, the apartment feels palatial and is filled with simple pleasures-- beautiful art, a wall of wonderfully curated books, and a delicious selection of LPs with a simple record player.
What's more, you are only a 15 min walk to the wonderful park, filled with trails and beautiful sites, and the main street in Youngstown. Would have been happy to have spent a few more days just living in the room. Excited to go back next year and looking forward to seeing the wonderful work Erin is completing.
ALSO! Erin is rad. Super helpful and friendly. Would love to go back and pick her brain about the area.

Erin's apartment is actually more amazing than it looks in the photos. it's a huge space with lovely high ceilings and enormous windows that bring in lots of light. Everything was clean, the furniture was fun, the bed was comfy, the shower was great. We loved playing records on her record player. We got delicious takeout from a great Caribbean restaurant that Erin recommended called Dalia's. It's best to call to order - they came just after seven, when the cafe closed and that was perfect timing for us.
Erin was super communicative and helpful - when we accidentally left our dog food and pills behind, she was quick to offer to send them to us. She went above and beyond.
I highly recommend this space.

review_text:
Easily one of the coolest, unique and comfortable lofts Iâ€™ve stayed in. We found Erinâ€™s spot while moving across the country with our 3 cats, all of whom loved to explore the huge space.
Beautifully curated, charming, unpretentious, and fascinating building with an interesting history worth looking into and worth appreciating. After reading a bit about it, Erin seems to be doing something really important and admire the effort sheâ€™s put into the space and her project at large. Iâ€™d much rather give Erin my money to support this place than some average AirBnB slumlord.
No TV is a non-issue, so I donâ€™t particularly understand the gripe with that â€” in my opinion, the space is much more oriented towards congregating, talking, listening to music, reading, and so on. If you want to watch something, use a laptop or something. Any street noise was negligible â€” Iâ€™ve stayed in residential neighborhoods that were louder.
In all, Erin was great, responsive (got a bit turned around with getting in the building, but Erin clarified in like less than 2 minutes), parking was convenient and safe. Had a great coffee and lunch on our way out. We liked Youngstown. Weâ€™d come back. 10/10

name: Mara
rating_info:

,

September 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Rachel's house was the perfect space for our group. Arrival and departure information was easily accessible and very easy to do, and the welcome basket with snacks and juices and water in the fridge were very much appreciated after a long day of travel.
The house was clean, and stayed very cool despite a hot summer weekend. We found the beds in the rooms we used to be very comfortable! While we did not use the second bathroom in the basement, the bathroom on the upper level was spacious. The water pressure isn't very strong, but it did get nice and warm. We felt very safe in the house and appreciated the smartlock for ease of access for multiple adults.
The neighborhood was quiet and peaceful, but I would note for anyone unfamiliar with this area that it can be hard to get an Uber at times, so you'd definitely want a car if you plan to explore! Rachel's guidebook offered a lot of great suggestions of things to see and do in the area. There was a lot of room to park multiple cars.

We had our 4 kids with us ( ages 8, 7, 5, and 3) and this house worked out perfectly for us! It was charming, well maintained, beautifully decorated, and had everything that we needed to enjoy our stay. We ended up cooking breakfast, lunch, and dinner in the kitchen. The Mill Creek Wick Recreation Park entertained our kids for hours with a splash pad, playground, and sand area. The Oh WOW! Center for Science and Technology was a great way to spend a morning. Definitely check out the Fellows Riverside Garden. The library inside had a cute children's section that was great for our kids when it started to pour.

review_text: Really wonderful, comfortable home in a quiet neighborhood. This house was a perfect central location for my PA/OH family to meet. The space was large and welcoming. Comfortable beds and furniture. The house was super clean and obviously well cared for and attended to. The host was available via text for a few minor questions, with immediate responses. The neighborhood was quiet and walkable - we even walked to the supermarket a half mile away for a forgotten item through the pleasant neighborhood. Bedding and towels were good quality. The kitchen was very well prepared for a family gathering with homemade meals. The Craftsman style home feels warm and personal (speaking as someone who lives in a Craftsman home). It has a very "homey" appeal. My sister probably said it best, remarking "this just sort of feels like we are 'at home.' " I will absolutely try to plan another family visit here again. My thanks and gratitude to our hosts.

review_text:
We are so glad we booked Rachel when we went to Ohio to see family! She and her husband are excellent communicators and were quick to help when we couldn't figure out the AC that first night. Rich even offered to pick us up a few things from the store since that's where he was when we called. Rich also suggested a museum our toddler loved. Visiting the Amish Market was his idea, and we were NOT disappointed.
The neighborhood felt safe and the neighbors were friendly. The house is beautiful and well furnished. The kitchen has plenty of gadgets and dishes, and Rachel had plenty of snacks around and bottled water in the fridge. There's lots of natural light and the claw foot tub is beautiful.
It is worth noting that the bathroom is on the second floor in case you've got mobility issues or find it difficult to do stairs.
Book at Rachel's place, enjoy some coffee on the porch, and have a blast in Youngstown!

Overall, Iâ€™d recommend Kathrynâ€™s place to anyone passing through.

The accommodations were perfect, bed was great, amenities were beyond reproach and even Kathrynâ€™s two â€œgreeterâ€ pooches were perfect. The address is in a quiet, residential area but still gives a feel for Youngstown as it used to be with former industrial areas nearby, YSU and Mill Creek Park a short ride away and sources for whatever you might need within a short hop. All-in-all I think I lucked into a definite cone-back-to place.

Group trip
review_text: One of the most beautiful and clean airbnb's i have ever stayed at!! Absolutely gorgeous! If you are looking in the area THIS is the place to stay! All of the beds are super comfortable, even the sleeper sofa! The area is very nice and quiet. My family felt comfortable being outside even after dark. The host provides everything you need to feel at home! 1 and only thing is that if you are traveling with more people and need to use the basement pullout couch just know that the basement is SUPER noisy! The shower is directly above the sleeper sofa and everytime someone showers, uses the sink or flushes the toilet you WILL be woken up. Also the air-conditioning kicking on is like a mac truck coming through the basement. However, if you are only using the upstairs bedrooms this will not affect you AT ALL. That being said we had an amazing stay and would 100% stay again when in the area! Thank you so much for the beautiful CLEAN home!!

review_text:
Our stay at The Pink Door at Newport Lake was fantastic! The entire home was beautiful and comfortable. The amenities were outstanding, and you truly feel like you are staying in a home away from home. We were so pleased with the decor and the little touches that Jody, our host, brought to every corner of the home.
The location of The Pink Door could not be better. It is within walking distance of Lanterman's Mill in Mill Creek Park, which is a must-see for nature lovers. We also found that we were walking distance to an amazing local co-op called Common Goods Studio, which showcases local vegan food, clothing, candles, and crafts. We enjoyed a Mamalagels Sriracha Everything bagel and coffee, both of which were amazing.
Jody was there for us our entire stay and made our arrival and departure a breeze. There is no doubt in my mind that I will be staying at The Pink Door at Newport Lake again.

review_text: Kathryn enjoys hosting as is evident by her efforts to make the apt cozy and to communicate with guests, even left a personal message. I needed a quiet place to complete a digital project, which I did. The place is older, perhaps built in the 30s or 40s but very clean. Neighborhood, quiet, water pressure, strong and water, hot. I recommend her place but I would feel better mentioning some things as full disclosure. Refrigerator is a hotel size, not apartment size. Don't plan to buy many groceries that would require refrigeration. The windows in the bedroom and bathroom opened which I liked. Night was quiet. I was a bit surprised that two of the apartment windows, original to the house, were pulled-to with string but didn't close all the way. There was a gap of about 2-3 inches and stuffed with insulation. It looked as if they had been this way for a while. This is not something I expected to see. I appreciate the clean accommodations and Kathryn's kind communication.

review_text: Our stay at Kathrynâ€™s was great! I absolutely loved the added touch of a coffee bar. Utensils/ dishes / appliances were available as well as some spices and seasonings. Cozy and functional living space. Attention to minor accommodations that make a big difference (board games, coloring, plush blankets). Some spaces were a bit tighter than expected and there were stairs leading up to our space- this was fine for our family but may not be ideal for others with mobility restrictions. My biggest criticism would be that there was a decent bit of dust (blinds, ceiling fans, some less used surfaces) although the space was tidy and clean otherwise. Grocery and general stores within short driving distance. Great local nature trails and waterfalls!
